data.name: Be Heard
data.description: Be Heard was a group Hackathon project,where we collabed to bring more awareness to Oppression.This Project included important information regarding this situation and also built a Blog API that allows users to visit the site and post their stories.

data.name: Gateway Website R2H
data.description: This is the first project I built in the Road to Hire program. This is a website built on one of my favorite places in the world. The website is built using standard HTML, and CSS. This is probably one of my fav projects due to its what got me to where I am today.

data.name: TicTacToe Application
data.description: This application allows the users to be able to play tic-tac-toe. With a simple click you're able to mark a box with a X or O. This application is built using React.js.

data.name: JS Hamburger Navbar
data.description: This application has a nav bar that is able to be toggled back and forth by clicking on the hamburger icon. This application uses CSS and js that allows some functionality to be applied when clicked.

data.name: React E-comm Project
data.description: This application is a remake of my Static E-comms project. This application is built using React.js, and is styled using SASS. Here on this E-comm website you are able to get a brief description of the company then, you are able to go to the products page to see what we have. These products can also be filtered and sorted that allows users to choose specific items.

data.name: First E-comm Project
data.description: The first draft of my E-comm project. This is a static built application,  that uses standard HTML, and CSS. This website was built so that if it was run through lighthouse it would have high scores in SEO,Accessibility and Best practices.

data.name: CLT Health Help
data.description: This is a group Hackathon project where we had to build a web application that informed users of any free clinics in the Charlotte area. This application was built using HTML and CSS. In this application we used Github to collaborate as a team, and also build more knowledge on githubâ€™s use.

data.name: Terminal Pokemon game
data.description: This is a terminal project that uses node.js. When ran in the terminal it starts a pokemon mini game that allows a user to pick a pokemon and name it. It also allows the user to battle another pokemon.
